ygData.subject: Re: strength
ygData.msgSnippet: Secondly, STR determines upper damage caps which becomes more obvious at levels 20+. The bonus is significant, and the looting capacity is very nice at the
ygData.messageBody:
Secondly, STR determines upper damage caps which becomes more obvious at
levels 20+. The bonus is significant, and the looting capacity is very nice
at the upper levels when you are finding many weapons and plate level armor.
For those reasons, I *highly* recommend this stat for melee types, and you
might even consider a bit for mage types.

Hmm, so whats this 20+ thing? Dont you wish this game had a real manuel with
the number saying exactly what something does. got the above passage from
stratics, but, i see what you are saying Countess,
Would we have been better off to put some of them points on agility and
such? Its prety confusing if ya ask me,
oh well,
thanx for the help
----- Original Message -----
From: Countess Bathory <countess_bathory_69@...>
To: <shadowknight@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, May 17, 1999 2:53 PM
Subject: Re: [shadowknight] strength


> From: Countess Bathory <countess_bathory_69@...>
>
> Strength adds to the attack roll, which helps determine how often max
> damage is dealt with a chosen weapon.
> Anyone who can weild a specific weapon will do the same amount of max
> damage. But how often that happens is partially determined by strength.
>
> Bathory
> Cazic-Thule
>
> --- "Steven E. Phipps" <phipps@...> wrote:
> > Okie, my wife is an ogre, level 18 sk...
> > What good is the strength? The DE hit just as hard
> > as she does...
> > How about all that stamina? The DE have just as many
> > hitpoints?
> > Ermm, anyone know whats up with this? Is the 150 str
> > good just for carrying loot?
> > Morgul
> >
